description.narrative: Enable policy framework and capacity development for green energy SMEs and access to finance and business models for green energy SMEs and energy service users piloted in Kyrgyzstan.

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. Number of policy recommendations for private investments in providing green energy through SMEs developed and presented with national stakeholders in both countries 2. Number of people (disaggregated by sex and age) trained on construction, maintenance and installation of their own energy efficient cook stoves, solar thermal systems and other energy generating systems (150) 3. Number of women and men led SMEs established with support by Energy Access Centers (2) 4.1 Number of microcredit institutions and banks joining the Energy Access Fund 4.2 Number of tailor made crowdfunding products designed with crowdfunding platforms 4.3 Number of financial incentives ensuring women’s access to finance 5. Number of business models piloted with established SMEs 6.2 Number of public buildings in villages with operational and sustainable PV and heating energy systems (5) 6.3 Number of households supported with green energy access through operational and sustainable small-scale technologies with ensured project co-financing (1250)

comment.narrative: 1. No enabling policy framework for energy access for SMEs 2. Lack of knowledge and awareness on energy access and energy efficient equipment, products and services 3. Scarce information for SMEs and their customers on affordable finance and how to access it 4. No knowledge on innovative financing mechanisms 5. No knowledge on innovative business models for SMEs 6. Access to sustainable energy services in remote rural areas not easily obtained

In addition to 2019 progress, the following results have been achieved across the project indicators. 1. 8 policy recommendations completed. Note: The Regulation “On the conditions and procedure for the implementation of activities for the generation and supply of electricity using renewable energy sources”, was approved by the government on 30th October 2020. 2. 288 people were trained on various green energy technologies such as PV systems, solar driers, biogas plants, energy efficient cook stoves, and solar thermal systems. 3. 2 SMEs supported with new RE technologies; namely “Texas Roadside Café” in Kyrgyzstan – Biogas plant, and Cooperative “Health committee of Svetlaya Poliyana” in Kyrgyzstan – Solar fruit drying equipment. 4.1 1 more bank identified as a collaborator for the energy access fund: Aiyl Bank (cooperation agreement) 4.3 Solar drier equipment was designed for women as end-users and purchase incentive in amount of 20% of the cost was provided by the project for 42 solar driers. 5. 3 models were tested: energy community model, pay-as-you-go model, rental model. 6.2 8 more public buildings were equipped with sustainable PV and heating systems, including repairing of their available renewable technologies. 6.3 7920 households accessed to green energy through small-scale technologies.

Kyrgyzstan completed one legislation to support green energy implementation, working closely with SMEs and conducted trainings for 274 people. Two banks were identified as main collaborators for the energy access fund. Three public buildings were equipped with solar hot water systems.
1. 1 legislation completed (Renewable energy legislation). 2. 47 men and 17 women in Kyrgyzstan were trained on various green energy technologies, mainly on PV systems, solar driers, biogas plants, energy efficient cook stoves, and solar thermal systems. Moreover, 210 children at the Jetigen International children camp were trained on solar energy in Kyrgyzstan. 3. Follow up discussions conducted for introducing the energy access funding platform and landscape analysis to select the most-fit businesses. 4.1 Bailyk Finance and Kompanion Bank were identified as main collaborators for the energy access fund. 4.3 The work is ongoing. 5. The work is in progress. 6.2 The project installed a solar hot water system in 3 public buildings: a public school “Ak Shoola” in Jel-Aryk. Bishkek homeless children facility and Serafimovka facility (for elderly and disabled people) have been provided with repairs of their available RE equipment. 6.3 Exact numbers are to be reported once the green solutions are implemented.
